domains.name: Number Sense & Place Value
domains.description: Develop counting, number relationships, and base-ten structure from concrete quantities through decimal understanding.

domains.name: Operations & Algebraic Thinking
domains.description: Build addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division fluency with an emphasis on strategies, structure, and early algebraic reasoning.

domains.name: Fractions & Rational Numbers
domains.description: Introduce unit fractions, equivalence, ordering, and operations connecting fractions to decimals and measurement contexts.

domains.name: Measurement & Data
domains.description: Measure attributes, tell time, work with money, and analyze data representations to solve real-world problems.

domains.name: Geometry & Spatial Reasoning
domains.description: Explore shapes, attributes, spatial relationships, and geometric measurement with progressive abstraction.

domains.name: Patterns & Algebraic Thinking
domains.description: Recognize, generalize, and represent patterns, relationships, and early functional thinking.

units.title: Addition Foundations
units.summary: Develop addition strategies from counting-on to make-ten and doubles using concrete models.

units.title: Addition & Subtraction Memorization
units.summary: Build fluency with addition and subtraction facts through structured drills and strategy reinforcement.

units.title: Data Displays
units.summary: Collect, represent, and interpret data using tables, picture graphs, bar graphs, and line plots.

units.title: Decimals & Base-Ten Structure
units.summary: Introduce decimal place value, fraction-decimal connections, and metric scaling using Montessori decimal materials.

units.title: Division Foundations
units.summary: Explore division as sharing and grouping using manipulatives before abstract algorithms.

units.title: Early Patterns
units.summary: Recognize and extend repeating and growing patterns, building the basis for algebraic reasoning.

units.title: Expressions & Early Algebra
units.summary: Bridge arithmetic to algebraic thinking through factors, patterns, expressions, and simple equations.

units.title: Foundations of Counting
units.summary: Establish cardinality, stable counting order, and quantity comparisons within five and ten using concrete materials.

units.title: Fraction & Decimal Operations
units.summary: Apply fraction and decimal relationships to addition, subtraction, multiplication, and contextual problem solving.

units.title: Fraction Equivalence & Ordering
units.summary: Develop equivalence, ordering, and benchmarking skills to prepare for operations with unlike denominators.

units.title: Fraction Foundations
units.summary: Establish understanding of fractions as equal parts of wholes, sets, and number line positions.

units.title: Introduction to the Decimal System
units.summary: Build understanding of four-digit numbers using bead material, place-value cards, and number lines.

units.title: Length in Standard Units
units.summary: Measure, estimate, and operate with lengths using standard inch and centimeter units.

units.title: Mass & Liquid Volume
units.summary: Measure and estimate mass and liquid volume, applying addition and subtraction in context.

units.title: Measurement & Data Extensions
units.summary: Advance to area, volume, fractional data displays, and coordinate graphing with problem-solving applications.

units.title: Measurement Foundations
units.summary: Explore measurable attributes using direct comparison and non-standard units before transitioning to standard units.

units.title: Measurement Geometry
units.summary: Connect geometry to measurement through area, surface area, and volume tasks.

units.title: Multi-Step Thinking
units.summary: Solve multi-step problems, analyze input-output tables, and articulate arithmetic patterns.

units.title: Multiplication & Division Mastery
units.summary: Extend multiplication and division to larger factors, regrouping, and multi-step problem solving with structural strategies.

units.title: Multiplication & Division Memorization
units.summary: Solidify multiplication and division facts with targeted drills and strategy-based grouping practice.

units.title: Multiplication Foundations
units.summary: Introduce multiplication and division through equal groups, arrays, and sharing contexts before abstraction.

units.title: Number Lines & Estimation
units.summary: Locate numbers, estimate sums/differences, and reason about magnitude on number lines and charts.

units.title: Operations Word Problems
units.summary: Apply addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division to multi-step contextual problems.

units.title: Place Value to 1000
units.summary: Develop hundreds understanding, rounding, and multi-step place-value reasoning for three-digit numbers.

units.title: Place Value to 120
units.summary: Extend base-ten understanding through two-digit numbers, regrouping tens and ones, and hundred-chart reasoning.

units.title: Plane Geometry
units.summary: Deepen understanding of polygons, arrays, lines, angles, and symmetry building toward geometric reasoning.

units.title: Pre-Algebra Foundations
units.summary: Bridge to formal algebra with expressions, variables, coordinate relationships, and simple inequalities.

units.title: Shape Foundations
units.summary: Recognize and describe shapes, positions, and simple compositions using Montessori geometry materials.

units.title: Spatial Reasoning Extensions
units.summary: Apply coordinate reasoning, figure classification, and transformations to advanced spatial tasks.

units.title: Subtraction Foundations
units.summary: Model take-away and comparison subtraction with strategies for decomposing numbers and using number lines.

units.title: Teen Numbers & 20s
units.summary: Build place-value understanding for teen numbers and quantities to twenty across representations.

units.title: Time & Money
units.summary: Introduce telling time and counting money through concrete manipulatives and real-world contexts.

topics.title: Add Multiple Two-Digit Numbers
topics.overview: Add three or four two-digit numbers using place-value strategies and regrouping when needed.

topics.title: Add and Subtract Decimals
topics.overview: Perform decimal addition and subtraction to hundredths with alignment and reasoning.

topics.title: Add and Subtract Lengths
topics.overview: Solve problems adding and subtracting lengths in the same units using drawings and equations.

topics.title: Add/Subtract Fractions with Like Denominators
topics.overview: Add and subtract fractions and mixed numbers with like denominators using models and equations.

topics.title: Add/Subtract Fractions with Unlike Denominators
topics.overview: Use equivalent fractions to create common denominators and solve problems with unlike denominators.

topics.title: Addition Fact Drills
topics.overview: Practice addition facts within 10 and 20 using timed drills and strategy prompts.

topics.title: Additive Word Problems
topics.overview: Solve join, separate, and compare problems using addition and subtraction strategies.

topics.title: Analyze Transformations
topics.overview: Investigate translations, rotations, and reflections on grids.

topics.title: Area and Perimeter of Rectangles
topics.overview: Find area and perimeter using tiling, arrays, and formulas for rectangles.

topics.title: Area of Rectangles and Triangles
topics.overview: Calculate area using arrays, base-height formulas, and decomposition strategies.

topics.title: Balance Contexts
topics.overview: Represent equality as balance using manipulatives and simple equations.

topics.title: Benchmark Fractions
topics.overview: Use benchmarks such as 1/2 and 1 to estimate and compare fractions.

topics.title: Choose Measurement Tools
topics.overview: Select appropriate tools and units for measuring objects and quantities.

topics.title: Classify 2D Figures in Hierarchies
topics.overview: Use hierarchies to classify polygons based on properties of sides and angles.

topics.title: Classify and Record Data
topics.overview: Sort objects by shared attributes and record category results on charts.

topics.title: Classify Shapes by Attributes
topics.overview: Group shapes based on attributes such as number of sides, angles, or faces.

topics.title: Compare Length, Weight, and Capacity
topics.overview: Directly compare attributes using informal language and non-standard units.

topics.title: Compare Numbers to 20
topics.overview: Compare and order numbers to twenty using models, number lines, and comparison symbols.

topics.title: Compare and Order Decimals
topics.overview: Compare decimals using place-value charts, number lines, and benchmarks.

topics.title: Compare and Order Numbers to 1000
topics.overview: Compare multi-digit numbers using place-value reasoning, symbols, and word descriptions.

topics.title: Compare Quantities by Matching
topics.overview: Use matching and counting strategies to identify more, less, or equal groups up to ten.

topics.title: Compare Unit Fractions
topics.overview: Compare unit fractions using size of denominators and visual models.

topics.title: Compare Unlike Fractions
topics.overview: Compare fractions with different denominators using common denominators or numerators.

topics.title: Comparison Word Problems
topics.overview: Interpret and solve compare problems with unknown differences using equations and diagrams.

topics.title: Compose and Decompose Hundreds
topics.overview: Regroup hundreds, tens, and ones using concrete hierarchical materials.

topics.title: Compose and Decompose Shapes
topics.overview: Combine and break apart shapes to form new figures and understand part-whole relationships.

topics.title: Compose and Decompose Teen Numbers
topics.overview: Represent teen numbers as ten ones and some more ones with beads, frames, and numerals.

topics.title: Compose and Decompose Thousands
topics.overview: Use thousand cubes, hundred squares, ten bars, and unit beads to build and break apart four-digit numbers.

topics.title: Coordinate Plane Graphing
topics.overview: Graph and interpret points in the first quadrant to model measurement contexts.

topics.title: Coordinate Plane Polygons
topics.overview: Plot vertices and analyze polygons on the coordinate plane, connecting to area and perimeter.

topics.title: Coordinate Relationships
topics.overview: Model relationships between two variables on the coordinate plane.

topics.title: Count Back and Count Up
topics.overview: Use counting-back and counting-up strategies to solve subtraction within 20.

topics.title: Count Coins: Pennies to Quarters
topics.overview: Identify and count collections of coins up to one dollar using skip counting.

topics.title: Count Story Problems within 5
topics.overview: Represent join and separate situations within five using objects, drawings, and verbal equations.

topics.title: Count to 20 and by Tens to 100
topics.overview: Count forward to 20 from any number and skip-count by tens to 100 using objects, number lines, and hundred charts.

topics.title: Counting-On Addition
topics.overview: Use counting-on strategies with objects, number lines, and mental models to add within 20.

topics.title: Counting within 10
topics.overview: Extend counting to ten across scattered, structured, and sequential contexts with number wordâ€”numeral connections.

topics.title: Counting within 5
topics.overview: Establish stable counting order and one-to-one correspondence for quantities up to five using concrete objects.

topics.title: Data Variability and Measures
topics.overview: Describe distributions using mean, median, mode, range, and variability measures.

topics.title: Describe Positions
topics.overview: Use positional words to describe locations of objects relative to others.

topics.title: Distributive and Associative Strategies
topics.overview: Apply properties of operations to simplify multiplication and division problems.

topics.title: Division as Grouping
topics.overview: Interpret division as forming equal groups and determine how many groups can be made.

topics.title: Division as Sharing
topics.overview: Model division as equal sharing and relate it to multiplication facts.

topics.title: Division Fact Strategies
topics.overview: Connect division facts to known multiplication facts and quotient patterns.

topics.title: Division Word Problems
topics.overview: Solve division story problems involving sharing and grouping with concrete and visual models.

topics.title: Doubles and Near Doubles
topics.overview: Use doubles facts and adjustments to solve addition within twenty.

topics.title: Dynamic Addition within 100
topics.overview: Perform two-digit addition with regrouping using place-value models, number lines, and algorithms.

topics.title: Dynamic Addition within 1000
topics.overview: Use place-value strategies and algorithms to add three-digit numbers with regrouping across hundreds.

topics.title: Dynamic Multiplication
topics.overview: Multiply multi-digit numbers with regrouping using dot game, bead frames, and checkerboard.

topics.title: Dynamic Subtraction within 100
topics.overview: Perform two-digit subtraction with regrouping using concrete models, number lines, and algorithms.

topics.title: Dynamic Subtraction within 1000
topics.overview: Subtract three-digit numbers with regrouping using base-ten models, number lines, and algorithms.

topics.title: Elapsed Time to the Minute
topics.overview: Solve start, end, and elapsed time problems to the minute on number lines and clocks.

topics.title: Equal Groups and Arrays
topics.overview: Build foundational multiplication concepts through repeated addition, equal groups, and array structures.

topics.title: Equal Groups Word Problems
topics.overview: Model equal groups situations that require multiplication or division solutions.

topics.title: Equations with Variables
topics.overview: Write and solve simple equations using variables to represent unknowns.

topics.title: Estimate on Number Lines
topics.overview: Place four-digit numbers on open and labeled number lines, estimating midpoints and benchmarks.

topics.title: Estimate Sums and Differences
topics.overview: Use friendly numbers and number lines to estimate results of addition and subtraction problems.

topics.title: Evaluate Numerical Expressions
topics.overview: Evaluate expressions with parentheses, brackets, and braces following order of operations.

topics.title: Even and Odd Numbers
topics.overview: Classify numbers as even or odd using pairing, arrays, and skip-counting patterns.

topics.title: Expanded Form to 120
topics.overview: Express two- and three-digit numbers in expanded form and standard form with manipulatives.

topics.title: Multiplication & Division Fact Families
topics.overview: Organize related multiplication and division facts to reinforce inverse relationships.

topics.title: Subtraction Fact Families
topics.overview: Relate subtraction to addition using fact families and part-part-whole diagrams.

topics.title: Fact Families within 20
topics.overview: Relate addition and subtraction facts using part-part-whole and inverse reasoning.

topics.title: Factors and Multiples
topics.overview: Analyze factor pairs and multiples to support number theory and algebraic reasoning.

topics.title: Facts within 20 Applications
topics.overview: Apply fluent addition and subtraction facts within 20 to stories and mixed practice.

topics.title: Fraction-Decimal Conversion
topics.overview: Convert between fractions and decimals using division and place value.

topics.title: Multiply Fractions
topics.overview: Model and compute products of fractions and interpret results as scaling.

topics.title: Fractions of Sets
topics.overview: Determine fractional parts of sets and connect to repeated subtraction and division.

topics.title: Generate Equivalent Fractions
topics.overview: Use models and numerical reasoning to create equivalent fractions.

topics.title: Generate Measurement Data and Line Plots
topics.overview: Measure lengths to the nearest whole unit, record data, and display results on line plots.

topics.title: Graph Points in the Coordinate Plane
topics.overview: Graph ordered pairs and interpret coordinate relationships in context.

topics.title: Hundred Chart Navigation
topics.overview: Use hundred charts to locate numbers, skip count, and recognize place-value patterns.

topics.title: Identify 2D and 3D Shapes
topics.overview: Name and recognize common two- and three-dimensional shapes in various orientations.

topics.title: Input-Output Tables
topics.overview: Analyze and generalize rules generating values in tables.

topics.title: Interpret Data Word Problems
topics.overview: Solve contextual problems using information from tables and graphs.

topics.title: Intro Equations and Inequalities
topics.overview: Represent relationships with simple equations and inequalities using variables.

topics.title: Intro Inequalities
topics.overview: Represent and solve simple inequalities, interpreting solution sets on number lines.

topics.title: Line Plots with Fractions
topics.overview: Create and interpret line plots featuring fractional measurements.

topics.title: Line Plots with Whole Numbers
topics.overview: Create and analyze line plots using whole-number measurements.

topics.title: Lines and Angles
topics.overview: Identify and classify lines (parallel, perpendicular) and angles (acute, right, obtuse).

topics.title: Locate Numbers on Number Lines
topics.overview: Place whole numbers within 1,000 on number lines with varying scales and intervals.

topics.title: Long Division
topics.overview: Divide dividends up to four digits using racks & tubes, bead frames, and standard algorithm representations.

topics.title: Make Given Amounts
topics.overview: Use coins to create specified values and exchange sets for equivalent amounts.

topics.title: Make-Ten Bridge
topics.overview: Apply make-ten reasoning to addition and subtraction with teen numbers.

topics.title: Make-Ten Combinations
topics.overview: Decompose numbers within twenty to create ten and understand complements of ten.

topics.title: Make-Ten Fluency
topics.overview: Reinforce make-ten combinations and decompositions to accelerate mental calculation.

topics.title: Mass and Liquid Volume
topics.overview: Measure and estimate masses in grams/kilograms and liquid volumes in liters; solve one-step problems.

topics.title: Measure Lengths with Rulers
topics.overview: Measure, estimate, and compare lengths using inch and centimeter rulers to the nearest whole unit.

topics.title: Measurement Conversions
topics.overview: Convert measurements within the same system using tables, equations, and word problems.

topics.title: Metric Measurement Scaling
topics.overview: Apply decimal understanding to metric units, conversions, and scaling problems.

topics.title: Mixed Fact Drills
topics.overview: Blend multiplication and division facts in timed practice to build automaticity.

topics.title: Mixed Numbers on Number Lines
topics.overview: Represent mixed numbers and improper fractions on number lines.

topics.title: Multi-Step Problem Solving
topics.overview: Solve multi-step operational problems with reasoning and representation.

topics.title: Multi-Step Word Problems
topics.overview: Solve multi-step problems involving multiplication and division with reasoning about remainders.

topics.title: Multiplication Fact Strategies
topics.overview: Use patterns, doubles, and area models to internalize multiplication facts up to 10Ã—10.

topics.title: Multiply by Multiples of 10
topics.overview: Use place-value understanding to multiply a one-digit number by multiples of ten (10â€“90).

topics.title: Multiply Fractions by Whole Numbers
topics.overview: Interpret fraction multiplication as repeated addition and scaling.

topics.title: Numerical Expressions
topics.overview: Write and evaluate numerical expressions with parentheses and multi-step operations.

topics.title: One More and One Less
topics.overview: Determine the next or previous number within ten by adding or removing a single unit.

topics.title: Order Objects by Attribute
topics.overview: Order objects by length, weight, or capacity using comparison results.

topics.title: Partition Shapes into Equal Parts
topics.overview: Partition shapes into halves, thirds, and fourths and describe each part as a fraction.

topics.title: Partition Shapes into Equal Parts (Geometry)
topics.overview: Partition shapes into equal shares and describe the parts using fractional language.

topics.title: Pattern Rules and Arithmetic Structure
topics.overview: Describe arithmetic patterns using properties and structure.

topics.title: Patterns and Rules
topics.overview: Describe and generalize patterns using tables, expressions, and verbal rules.

topics.title: Picture Graphs
topics.overview: Create and interpret picture graphs representing data with single-value symbols.

topics.title: Place Value Word Problems
topics.overview: Apply place-value reasoning to multi-step contextual problems within 1000.

topics.title: Read and Write 3-Digit Numbers
topics.overview: Interpret and record numbers to 1000 in standard, word, and expanded forms.

topics.title: Read and Write 4-Digit Numbers
topics.overview: Record four-digit numbers in standard and expanded forms using place-value cards and numerals.

topics.title: Read and Write Decimals
topics.overview: Express decimals through hundredths in word, standard, and expanded forms.

topics.title: Relate Division and Multiplication
topics.overview: Use arrays and fact families to connect division problems to multiplication facts.

topics.title: Relate Fractions and Decimals
topics.overview: Connect fraction and decimal representations through equivalence and conversion tasks.

topics.title: Repeating and Growing Patterns
topics.overview: Identify, extend, and create repeating and growing patterns with concrete materials.

topics.title: Represent Numbers to 20
topics.overview: Read, write, and model numbers to twenty across words, numerals, and manipulatives.

topics.title: Rounding on Number Lines
topics.overview: Round numbers to the nearest ten or hundred by identifying benchmark points on number lines.

topics.title: Rounding to the Nearest 10 and 100
topics.overview: Round numbers using number lines, base-ten models, and place-value understanding.

topics.title: Scaled Bar Graphs
topics.overview: Represent data using scaled bar graphs and solve one- and two-step problems.

topics.title: Skip Count by 2s, 5s, and 10s
topics.overview: Skip count using number lines, hundred charts, and arrays to prepare for multiplication.

topics.title: Skip Count on Number Lines
topics.overview: Skip count by 2s, 5s, 10s, and 100s on open number lines to reinforce multiplication patterns.

topics.title: Skip Counting for Multiplication Facts
topics.overview: Reinforce multiplication facts through rhythmic skip counting and bead chains.

topics.title: Static Multiplication
topics.overview: Multiply without regrouping using golden beads, stamp game, and array diagrams.

topics.title: Subtraction Fact Drills
topics.overview: Build subtraction fluency within 20 through structured drills and inverse relationships.

topics.title: Subtraction within 10
topics.overview: Solve subtraction situations within ten using manipulatives, drawings, and equations.

topics.title: Surface Area with Nets
topics.overview: Represent three-dimensional figures with nets to determine surface area.

topics.title: Symmetry and Reflection
topics.overview: Identify lines of symmetry and analyze reflections of shapes.

topics.title: Take-Away Models
topics.overview: Model subtraction with objects and drawings, showing removal of quantities within 20.

topics.title: Tally Charts and Tables
topics.overview: Collect data and represent it using tally charts and simple tables.

topics.title: Tell Time to the Nearest Five Minutes
topics.overview: Read analog and digital clocks to the nearest five minutes using a.m. and p.m. context.

topics.title: Tell Time to Hour, Half-Hour, and Quarter-Hour
topics.overview: Read analog and digital clocks to the hour, half-hour, and quarter-hour.

topics.title: Ten More and Ten Less
topics.overview: Find numbers that are ten more or less within 120 using models and hundred charts.

topics.title: Tens and Ones Composition
topics.overview: Compose and decompose two-digit numbers using tens and ones models and equations.

topics.title: Tenths and Hundredths Models
topics.overview: Use decimal materials and area models to represent tenths and hundredths.

topics.title: Thousand Chart Navigation
topics.overview: Locate and sequence numbers on a thousand chart to visualize base-ten structure and place-value patterns.

topics.title: Tile Rectangles with Rows and Columns
topics.overview: Partition rectangles into equal rows and columns of same-size squares and count the total tiles.

topics.title: Time and Money Word Problems
topics.overview: Solve contextual problems involving elapsed time and money totals or differences.

topics.title: Triangles and Quadrilaterals
topics.overview: Classify triangles and quadrilaterals by sides and angles using attribute reasoning.

topics.title: Paired Patterns
topics.overview: Generate and analyze two numerical patterns using given rules and corresponding terms.

topics.title: Two-Step Word Problems
topics.overview: Solve two-step problems mixing operations and explain the reasoning behind each step.

topics.title: Divide Unit Fractions
topics.overview: Divide unit fractions and whole numbers using models and equations.

topics.title: Unit Fractions on Number Lines
topics.overview: Locate and label unit fractions on number lines and strips.

topics.title: Unknown Addend Problems
topics.overview: Solve for unknown addends using part-part-whole and balance contexts.

topics.title: Volume Concepts
topics.overview: Understand volume as space filled by unit cubes and relate to multiplication and addition.

topics.title: Volume of Rectangular Prisms
topics.overview: Calculate volume using unit cubes and formula reasoning for rectangular prisms.

lessons.title: Bar Models for Additive Stories
lessons.notes: Build bar models to represent join, separate, and comparison word problems.

lessons.title: Choose Addition or Subtraction Strategies
lessons.notes: Explain which operation solves a story problem and justify the choice.

lessons.title: Explain Balanced Equations
lessons.notes: Show both sides of the scale have the same total and narrate why the equation is true.

lessons.title: Find Missing Values to Balance
lessons.notes: Add or remove tiles until the scale balances, then write the equation.

lessons.title: True or False Equations
lessons.notes: Decide whether each equation stays balanced by comparing both sides with counters and symbols.

lessons.title: Compare 2D and 3D Shapes
lessons.notes: Match solids to their faces and explain similarities to plane shapes.

lessons.title: Draw Shapes with Attributes
lessons.notes: Use attribute checklists to draw shapes with specified sides and angles.

lessons.title: Sort Shapes by Attributes
lessons.notes: Drag shapes into labeled regions based on sides, vertices, or whether they are curved.

lessons.title: Order Three Numbers to 20
lessons.notes: Arrange numeral cards on a digital strip and justify the order.

lessons.title: Compare Numbers with Place-Value Models
lessons.notes: Build two amounts with bead bars and cards, then choose <, >, or =.

lessons.title: Decompose Shapes with Pattern Blocks
lessons.notes: Cover outlines and describe the component shapes used.

lessons.title: Compose Shapes with Triangles
lessons.notes: Build rectangles and other figures from constructive triangles.

lessons.title: Counting Back on the Number Line
lessons.notes: Practice counting backward from any start within twenty.

lessons.title: Count Up to Find Differences
lessons.notes: Decide whether to count back or count up and justify the strategy.

lessons.title: Number Line Counting-On to 20
lessons.notes: Hop along the number line and then record the resulting addition sentence.

lessons.title: Counting-On to 20 with Strip Board
lessons.notes: Begin at the larger addend and slide additional strips while stating the running total.

lessons.title: Bead Stair Doubles
lessons.notes: Stack matching bead bars and say the doubles facts aloud.

lessons.title: Near Doubles Strategies
lessons.notes: Use number line hops and equations to show +1 and -1 adjustments.

lessons.title: Addition Fact Fluency to 10
lessons.notes: Timed digital flash cards with Montessori encouragement track accuracy.

lessons.title: Addition Fact Fluency to 20
lessons.notes: Blend doubles, make-ten, and near-doubles strategies during fluency sprints.

lessons.title: Subtraction Fact Fluency to 10
lessons.notes: Rapid subtraction cards reinforce takeaway within ten.

lessons.title: Subtraction Strategy Checkups
lessons.notes: Learners explain whether they counted back or used fact families to solve quickly.

lessons.title: Group Three Addends
lessons.notes: Regroup three addends to make ten or doubles before finding the total.

lessons.title: Turn-Around Facts with Number Bonds
lessons.notes: Build number bonds to show that switching addends gives the same total.

lessons.title: Fact Family Story Problems
lessons.notes: Connect stories to all four equations in the family.

lessons.title: Fact Family Triangle Board
lessons.notes: Place addends and totals on the fact triangle, then write all related facts.

lessons.title: Solve Unknowns in Fact Families
lessons.notes: Use bar models to determine which number completes each addition or subtraction equation.

lessons.title: Choose Strategies within 20
lessons.notes: Select doubles, make-ten, or count-on strategies for mixed facts.

lessons.title: Facts within 20 Word Problems
lessons.notes: Model and solve joining, separating, and comparison situations within twenty.

lessons.title: Compare Numbers on the Hundred Board
lessons.notes: Use place value and board positions to compare and order numbers up to 120.

lessons.title: Hundred Chart Neighbor Walk
lessons.notes: Explore forward and backward sequences on the hundred chart.

lessons.title: Hundred Chart Skip Patterns
lessons.notes: Highlight diagonal and row patterns produced by equal jumps.

lessons.title: Write Numbers to 120
lessons.notes: Fill missing numbers on the hundred board and record numerals beyond 100.

lessons.title: Number Line Bridge to Ten
lessons.notes: Hop to ten then the remainder, recording decomposed equations.

lessons.title: Bridge to Ten with Ten Frames
lessons.notes: Break addends and slide counters to make a full ten frame first.

lessons.title: Quick Draw Make-Ten
lessons.notes: Flashed ten frames encourage instant recognition of complements to ten.

lessons.title: Make-Ten Strategy Practice
lessons.notes: Convert problems into make-ten plus leftovers and the related subtraction.

lessons.title: Bead Stair Ten Partners
lessons.notes: Match complementary bead bars to build ten on the staircase.

lessons.title: Ten Partners Equation Cards
lessons.notes: Use movable digits to record teen compositions and make-ten decompositions.

lessons.title: Choose the Right Measurement Tool
lessons.notes: Drag classroom objects to the ruler, balance, or measuring cup.

lessons.title: Choose Appropriate Units
lessons.notes: Select standard or non-standard units to fit each measuring task.

lessons.title: Order Objects by Length
lessons.notes: Drag virtual rods to arrange from shortest to longest.

lessons.title: Measure and Record Attributes
lessons.notes: Measure each object with the chosen unit and enter the data.

lessons.title: Partition Halves and Fourths
lessons.notes: Partition circles and rectangles into halves and fourths and name each share.

lessons.title: Growing Patterns T-Chart
lessons.notes: Record pattern stages in a T-chart and describe the rule.

lessons.title: Extend Repeating Patterns
lessons.notes: Name the core of repeating sequences and continue them.

lessons.title: Double Ten Frame Representations
lessons.notes: Fill paired ten frames, then choose matching numeral and word labels.

lessons.title: Place-Value Cards to 20
lessons.notes: Use Montessori place-value cards with bead bars to read and record numbers to twenty.

lessons.title: Complete Subtraction Fact Families
lessons.notes: Fill in missing subtraction facts and explain the relationships.

lessons.title: Subtraction Fact Family Models
lessons.notes: Use the fact family board to show how addition and subtraction mirror each other.

lessons.title: Record Subtraction within Ten
lessons.notes: Translate modeled subtraction into equations and check with bead bars.

lessons.title: Subtraction Strip Board Stories
lessons.notes: Remove strips to model take-away and comparison situations within ten.

lessons.title: Number Line Take-Away to 20
lessons.notes: Hop backward to show subtraction within twenty.

lessons.title: Record Subtraction Equations to 20
lessons.notes: Translate modeled subtraction into written equations.

lessons.title: Stamp Game Take-Away Stories
lessons.notes: Model subtraction stories within ten using colored stamp tiles.

lessons.title: Create and Read Tally Charts
lessons.notes: Collect class data, mark tallies, and state totals.

lessons.title: Interpret Tally Tables
lessons.notes: Answer comparison questions using completed tally tables.

lessons.title: Ten More and Ten Less on the Hundred Board
lessons.notes: Use the hundred board to hop vertically and justify the change of ten.

lessons.title: Ten More/Less Story Problems
lessons.notes: Act out scenarios gaining or losing ten and record the result.

lessons.title: Golden Bead Tens and Ones
lessons.notes: Exchange ten unit beads for a ten bar and represent numbers through 120.

lessons.title: Stamp Game Tens and Ones
lessons.notes: Lay stamp tiles to match written numbers and record expanded equations.

lessons.title: Read Hour and Half-Hour
lessons.notes: Move the hour and minute hands to show o'clock and half-past times.

lessons.title: Quarter-Hour Clock Stories
lessons.notes: Rotate the clock to one quarter past and one quarter to given times.

lessons.title: Find Unknown Addends on Number Lines
lessons.notes: Hop forward from the known addend to reach the total and record the missing number.

lessons.title: Unknown Addends with Strip Board
lessons.notes: Cover part of the strip to discover the missing addend.

lessons.title: Stamp Game Addition within 1,000
lessons.notes: Add three-digit numbers with regrouping using the stamp game, then generalize the written algorithm.

lessons.title: Two-Digit Addition Strategies
lessons.notes: Model addition with bead bars, then shift to written strategies while explaining the regrouping logic.

lessons.title: Addition Word Problems within 100
lessons.notes: Represent multi-step addition stories with bar models before recording and solving the equation.

lessons.title: Rectilinear Area Investigation
lessons.notes: Decompose rectilinear figures and right triangles into rectangles, calculate area for each part, and justify the total.

lessons.title: Tile Rectangles for Area
lessons.notes: Cover rectangles with unit squares, record the area in square units, and connect to multiplication facts.

lessons.title: Arrays and Early Multiplication
lessons.notes: Cover the pattern board with rows and columns of tiles, then write the related multiplication equation.

lessons.title: Compare Hundreds with Models
lessons.notes: Load bead bars on each side of the scale to decide which three-digit number is greater.

lessons.title: Order Three-Digit Numbers
lessons.notes: Place number cards on the line, use comparison symbols, and arrange sets from least to greatest.

lessons.title: Compare with Bar Models
lessons.notes: Translate comparison statements into diagrams, highlight the unknown, and solve using related facts.

lessons.title: Interpret Data Representations
lessons.notes: Match story situations to bar, picture, or line graphs and use bar models to compute answers from the selected display.

lessons.title: Analyse Line Plots
lessons.notes: Plot class measurement data and interpret maximum, minimum, and difference questions.

lessons.title: Fraction Line Plots
lessons.notes: Collect fractional measurement data (halves, fourths, eighths) and display it on a line plot before answering comparison questions.

lessons.title: Build Picture Graphs
lessons.notes: Convert tally data into scaled picture graphs and answer comparison questions.

lessons.title: Scaled Bar Graph Construction
lessons.notes: Build scaled picture and bar graphs with Montessori counters, then answer how many more/less questions using the completed display.

lessons.title: Division Fact Strategies
lessons.notes: Apply related multiplication facts, repeated subtraction, and area models to evaluate division expressions.

lessons.title: Division as Equal Grouping
lessons.notes: Use bead bars to build equal groups, translate the structure to repeated subtraction on a number line, and record the matching division equation.

lessons.title: Relate Division and Multiplication
lessons.notes: Cover the pattern board with arrays to show inverse multiplication/division relationships and discuss efficient related-fact strategies.

lessons.title: Division as Sharing Equally
lessons.notes: Distribute counters into sorting trays to model sharing situations, connect the result to multiplication, and record the matching equation.

lessons.title: Solve Equal Groups Word Problems
lessons.notes: Use bar models to analyze equal-group stories, decide whether to multiply or divide, and justify the solution path.

lessons.title: Build Equal Groups
lessons.notes: Group bead bars into matching sets and record the repeated-addition sentence that names the total.

lessons.title: Balance Equations with Unknowns
lessons.notes: Use the digital balance to maintain equality while replacing unknowns with numbers, then graph related inequalities on a number line.

lessons.title: Estimation Strategy Lab
lessons.notes: Compare rounding, front-end estimation, and number-line jumps to choose efficient strategies for estimating sums and differences.

lessons.title: Even/Odd Pattern Investigation
lessons.notes: Extend number sequences and describe why sums or differences of even/odd numbers follow predictable patterns.

lessons.title: Sort Even and Odd Collections
lessons.notes: Pair counters in trays to decide whether sets are even or odd and apply parity rules to numerals.

lessons.title: Build Expanded Form to 120
lessons.notes: Layer unit, ten, and extra cards to model numbers before recording the matching expanded notation.

lessons.title: Convert Expanded Form to Standard Form
lessons.notes: Recombine expanded card strings and bead bars into standard numerals with self-check prompts.

lessons.title: Mixed Fact Fluency Studio
lessons.notes: Rotate through timed-yet-self-correcting practice, strategy reflection, and context problems mixing multiplication and division facts.

lessons.title: Multiplication/Division Fact Families
lessons.notes: Use triangle boards to generate and apply fact families that connect multiplication and division.

lessons.title: Strategies for Facts within 20
lessons.notes: Sort fact cards by strategy (doubles, make-ten, count-on) and justify each efficient choice.

lessons.title: Facts within 20 Word Problems
lessons.notes: Apply fluent facts to quick story mats that mix addition and subtraction contexts.

lessons.title: Compare Fractions
lessons.notes: Use fraction insets to reason about the size of unit fractions and justify comparisons with like numerators or denominators.

lessons.title: Generate Equivalent Fractions
lessons.notes: Partition shapes and number lines to show equivalent fractions and justify the multiplicative relationship between numerator and denominator.

lessons.title: Fractions on Number Lines
lessons.notes: Mark equal jumps on bead-linked number lines to locate and compare unit and non-unit fractions, including wholes represented as fractions.

lessons.title: Fractions of Sets and Division
lessons.notes: Distribute beads into equal groups to model fractions of sets, compute the fractional amount, and explain the link to division.

lessons.title: Hundred Chart Neighbor Paths
lessons.notes: Trace vertical and horizontal moves on the digital hundred board to highlight near-number relationships.

lessons.title: Hundred Chart Pattern Investigation
lessons.notes: Color multiples of 5 and 10, then read and compare highlighted entries to describe emerging patterns.

lessons.title: Build Three-Digit Numbers
lessons.notes: Compose hundreds, tens, and ones with bead material, then record the numeral that matches the build.

lessons.title: Bundle Tens into Hundreds
lessons.notes: Trade ten ten-bars for a hundred square and document the exchange with place-value cards.

lessons.title: Decompose Hundreds Strategically
lessons.notes: Break apart hundreds into tens and ones to solve multi-step scenarios and explain the role of zeros.

lessons.title: Explain Three-Digit Place Value
lessons.notes: Describe the value of each digit using stamp tiles and complete explanatory sentence frames.

lessons.title: Decompose to Make Ten
lessons.notes: Use jumps on a number line to split addends and show how the make-ten strategy simplifies sums.

lessons.title: Stamp Game Make-Ten Bridge
lessons.notes: Exchange unit stamps for a ten to model the make-ten addition bridge before recording equations.

lessons.title: Add and Subtract Lengths
lessons.notes: Model combined lengths on an open number line and interpret the result in measurement stories.

lessons.title: Estimate and Compare Lengths
lessons.notes: Predict lengths, measure to confirm, and analyze differences when switching measurement units.

lessons.title: Create Measurement Line Plots
lessons.notes: Record repeated measurements in a table and transfer the data to a line plot with unit labels.

lessons.title: Measure Mass with Scales
lessons.notes: Use gram weights on a digital balance scale to determine the mass of classroom objects and record the findings.

lessons.title: Mass and Volume Story Problems
lessons.notes: Use bar models and measurement logs to solve real-world mass and liquid volume problems.

lessons.title: Measure with Rulers
lessons.notes: Align digital rulers to objects, emphasize starting at zero, and record measurements in both units.

lessons.title: Select Measurement Tools
lessons.notes: Drag measurement scenarios onto the shelf to match appropriate tools and units.

lessons.title: Measure Liquid Volume
lessons.notes: Fill graduated Montessori pitchers to given marks to compare and combine liquid volumes.

lessons.title: Count Mixed Coins
lessons.notes: Drag virtual coins into counting strips and state the running total aloud.

lessons.title: Make Target Amounts
lessons.notes: Build a required amount with coins, then optimise to use the fewest pieces possible.

lessons.title: Time and Money Story Problems
lessons.notes: Tackle multi-step problems that mix elapsed time and coin values using bar models.

lessons.title: Plan Multi-Step Solutions
lessons.notes: Break complex stories into sequential bars, write supporting equations, and justify the overall plan.

lessons.title: Distributive and Associative Strategies
lessons.notes: Decompose arrays and regroup factors to apply distributive and associative reasoning for larger facts.

lessons.title: Multiplication Fact Strategy Lab
lessons.notes: Use bead bars and area models to apply commutative, identity, and doubling strategies to multiplication facts.

lessons.title: Multiply by Multiples of Ten
lessons.notes: Decompose multiples of ten into tens and ones, then apply distributive reasoning to multiply quickly.

lessons.title: Skip Counting for Multiplication Facts
lessons.notes: Use bead-linked number lines and tables to extend skip-counting patterns, fill missing multiples, and solve multiplication stories.

lessons.title: Static Multiplication Arrays
lessons.notes: Build and record arrays to compute products, explain the model, and find unknown factors or quotients.

lessons.title: Benchmark Points on Number Lines
lessons.notes: Use bead markers to anchor 0, midpoint, and endpoint values before labeling intermediate numbers.

lessons.title: Estimate on Open Number Lines
lessons.notes: Place approximate hops on an open number line to predict sums and differences quickly.

lessons.title: Locate Numbers to 1,000
lessons.notes: Partition an open number line into equal segments to position three-digit numbers accurately.

lessons.title: Locate Multiples of Ten
lessons.notes: Hop along bead markers to land on tens and identify numbers that fall between them.

lessons.title: Skip Count by Tens on Number Lines
lessons.notes: Place equal jumps of ten on an open number line and annotate each landing point.

lessons.title: Skip Count Mixed Intervals
lessons.notes: Alternate jumps of five and ten on a shared number line to notice repeating structures.

lessons.title: Describe Fractional Parts
lessons.notes: Shade and label fractional regions, then explain how many unit parts form the whole.

lessons.title: Partition Shapes into Equal Parts
lessons.notes: Use draggable partition bars to split circles and rectangles into equal halves and fourths.

lessons.title: Hundred Chart Pattern Explorer
lessons.notes: Highlight addition and multiplication patterns on the hundred board, then record the rule that generates the table.

lessons.title: Arithmetic Pattern Machine
lessons.notes: Program a digital function machine with repeated addition or multiplication rules, then describe the pattern using properties.

lessons.title: Perimeter Walk
lessons.notes: Trace the border of rectangles and composite shapes, then apply perimeter formulas to compute the total boundary length.

lessons.title: Place Value Problem Lab
lessons.notes: Use place-value disks and bar models to interpret multi-step problems involving hundreds, tens, and ones.

lessons.title: Rounding with Bead Ladders
lessons.notes: Use bead ladders to compare numbers to the nearest ten and hundred, highlighting which benchmark they approach.

lessons.title: Rounding on Number Lines
lessons.notes: Place numbers on open number lines, identify the closest benchmark, explain the rounding choice, and apply it to context problems.

lessons.title: Skip Count with Bead Chains
lessons.notes: Walk bead chains in sets of twos and fives before recording the sequence on the counting mat.

lessons.title: Mixed Skip-Counting Challenges
lessons.notes: Follow jump cards on the hundred board to alternate between twos, fives, and tens.

lessons.title: Stamp Game Subtraction within 1,000
lessons.notes: Model exchanges across hundreds, tens, and ones to subtract within 1,000 and apply the strategy to contextual problems.

lessons.title: Two-Digit Subtraction Strategies
lessons.notes: Model exchanges on the strip board and narrate the place-value reasoning behind each subtraction step.

lessons.title: Subtraction Word Problems within 100
lessons.notes: Translate take-away scenarios into bar-model diagrams and solve using recorded regrouping steps.

lessons.title: Stamp Game Double-Digit Addition
lessons.notes: Exchange unit tiles for tens during addition and extend the strategy to three addends.

lessons.title: Strip Board Two-Digit Addition
lessons.notes: Layer tens and ones strips to model two-digit sums that do not require exchanging.

lessons.title: Thousand Chart Pattern Stories
lessons.notes: Describe vertical and diagonal patterns that emerge while moving across thousand chart strips.

lessons.title: Navigate the Thousand Chart
lessons.notes: Slide place-value markers along a thousand chart strip to anchor benchmarks and count by hundreds.

lessons.title: Tile Rectangles with Arrays
lessons.notes: Cover rectangles with unit squares, count rows and columns, and connect to multiplication sentences.

lessons.title: Elapsed Time on Timelines
lessons.notes: Use joint clock and timeline models to find elapsed time, missing starts, or end times to the nearest minute.

lessons.title: Tell Time to Five Minutes
lessons.notes: Spin the Montessori clock to show five-minute increments and record the matching time statements.

lessons.title: Solve Additive Word Problems
lessons.notes: Use comparison bars to plan solutions and articulate which strategy fits the context.

lessons.title: Comparison Situations with Addition
lessons.notes: Model 'how many more/less' contexts with bar diagrams before writing the matching equation.

lessons.title: Solve Two-Step Word Problems
lessons.notes: Execute two-step solution plans with bar models, record each equation, and verify the final answer.

lessons.title: Checkerboard Addition within 1,000
lessons.notes: Use the checkerboard or stamp game to add multiple three-digit numbers with regrouping.

lessons.title: Addition Strategy Journal
lessons.notes: Record and critique different addition strategies for the same three-digit problems.

lessons.title: Rectilinear Area Designs
lessons.notes: Break complex floor plans into rectangles and right triangles to compute total area.

lessons.title: Tile Lab for Area
lessons.notes: Cover rectangles with unit squares and connect the area to multiplication equations.

lessons.title: Interpret Multiple Data Representations
lessons.notes: Select the best graph for a situation and solve associated word problems.

lessons.title: Interpret Fraction Line Plots
lessons.notes: Solve comparison and difference questions based on fractional line plots.

lessons.title: Fraction Line Plot Project
lessons.notes: Collect fractional measurement data and plot it on a line graph with halves and fourths.

lessons.title: Scaled Graph Project
lessons.notes: Collect data, choose a scale, build the bar graph, and answer comparison questions.

lessons.title: Explain Division Solutions
lessons.notes: Construct written explanations that justify the chosen operation and interpretation of the quotient.

lessons.title: Advanced Division Fact Strategies
lessons.notes: Compare strategies for dividing within 100 and reflect on which method fits different fact families.

lessons.title: Division Grouping Mats
lessons.notes: Arrange bead bars into equal groups and express the action as a division equation.

lessons.title: Repeated Subtraction on Number Lines
lessons.notes: Translate equal groups into repeated subtraction jumps on an open number line.

lessons.title: Related Multiplication and Division Facts
lessons.notes: Use area models and bead arrays to highlight how multiplication and division facts are connected.

lessons.title: Share Sets Equally
lessons.notes: Share counters equally, record the division equation, and relate it to the inverse multiplication fact.

lessons.title: Division Story Analysis
lessons.notes: Decode division scenarios, build models, and solve for unknown group size or number of groups.

lessons.title: Analyze Equal-Group Stories
lessons.notes: Represent equal-group stories with bar models and determine when multiplication applies.

lessons.title: Equal Groups and Division
lessons.notes: Decide whether to divide to find group size or number of groups and justify the choice.

lessons.title: Balance Equations with Unknowns
lessons.notes: Use the balance scale to solve for unknowns represented by letters.

lessons.title: Estimate in Real-World Contexts
lessons.notes: Use bar models to plan estimates for multi-step scenarios, then check reasonableness against exact answers.

lessons.title: Estimation Strategy Workshop
lessons.notes: Compare rounding, front-end, and number-line jumps to decide which estimation strategy is most efficient.

lessons.title: Mixed Fact Challenge Studio
lessons.notes: Rotate through timed practice, strategy reflection, and story problems to solidify fact fluency.

lessons.title: Apply Multiplication/Division Fact Families
lessons.notes: Build triangle-board families and apply them to real-life multiplicative situations.

lessons.title: Compare Fractions with Insets
lessons.notes: Overlay fraction insets to reason about the size of different unit fractions.

lessons.title: Compare Fractions with Same Numerators or Denominators
lessons.notes: Plot fractions on a number line to justify comparisons with like numerators or denominators.

lessons.title: Equivalent Fractions with Area Models
lessons.notes: Shade equivalent regions to demonstrate how fractions can represent the same amount.

lessons.title: Generate Equivalent Fractions Strategically
lessons.notes: Scale numerators and denominators to generate equivalent fractions and position them on aligned number lines.

lessons.title: Build Fraction Number Lines
lessons.notes: Partition bead-linked number lines into equal jumps and label each unit fraction.

lessons.title: Compare Fractions on Number Lines
lessons.notes: Place non-unit fractions and show how whole numbers align with fractional equivalents.

lessons.title: Fractions of Sets Lab
lessons.notes: Share skittles into equal groups to compute fractions of sets and record supporting equations.

lessons.title: Interpret Fractions as Division
lessons.notes: Connect fractional set problems to division expressions and explain the quotient meaning.

lessons.title: Quadrilateral Hierarchy
lessons.notes: Organize quadrilaterals by properties and discuss relationships among categories.

lessons.title: Triangle Classification Box
lessons.notes: Sort triangles by side and angle properties using constructive triangles.

lessons.title: Graph and Interpret Inequalities
lessons.notes: Plot inequality solutions on a number line and explain the meaning in context.

lessons.title: Compare Object Masses
lessons.notes: Measure and compare masses using gram weights and record differences.

lessons.title: Mass and Volume Problem Solving
lessons.notes: Use bar models to tackle multi-step scenarios involving mass and liquid volume.

lessons.title: Mix and Measure Volume
lessons.notes: Combine and compare liquid volumes using Montessori pitchers and graduated cylinders.

lessons.title: Multi-Step Case Studies
lessons.notes: Analyze rich problems, plan sequences of operations, and justify each step.

lessons.title: Area Strategies for Facts
lessons.notes: Create area models to visualize multiplication facts and explore identity/zero cases.

lessons.title: Distributive & Associative Reasoning
lessons.notes: Cut and rearrange arrays to justify distributive and associative strategies for large facts.

lessons.title: Multiply by Multiples of Ten
lessons.notes: Use place-value cards and bead bars to multiply single-digit numbers by multiples of ten.

lessons.title: Multiplication Strategy Lab
lessons.notes: Apply commutative and doubling strategies to tough facts using bead stair representations.

lessons.title: Partition Shape Mosaics
lessons.notes: Partition polygons into equal shares and verify equality by overlaying fraction insets.

lessons.title: Name Unit Fractions
lessons.notes: Label shaded regions with correct unit fraction names and explain the numerator/denominator roles.

lessons.title: Generalize Arithmetic Rules
lessons.notes: Explain how multiplication properties create patterns across rows and columns.

lessons.title: Input-Output Machine Patterns
lessons.notes: Program function machines and hundred-chart tables to identify arithmetic patterns.

lessons.title: Perimeter Exploration
lessons.notes: Measure polygon sides with digital strips and apply perimeter formulas.

lessons.title: Analyze Place-Value Situations
lessons.notes: Interpret place-value puzzles with bar models and justify the strategy used.

lessons.title: Multi-Step Place-Value Challenges
lessons.notes: Tackle multi-step problems that intertwine comparisons, rounding, and operations on three-digit numbers.

lessons.title: Round with Bead Ladders
lessons.notes: Bundle golden beads into tens and hundreds, then decide which benchmark the number is nearest to.

lessons.title: Rounding in Context
lessons.notes: Model real-world problems that require rounding and record the reasoning with bar models.

lessons.title: Mental Rounding Strategies
lessons.notes: Use hundred-board highlight strips to practice rounding without manipulatives before recording equations.

lessons.title: Rounding on Open Number Lines
lessons.notes: Place numbers on an open line, mark benchmarks, and justify rounding choices aloud.

lessons.title: Factor Tracks Skip Counting
lessons.notes: Lay factor tracks on an open number line to solidify skip-counting sequences.

lessons.title: Complete Skip-Counting Patterns
lessons.notes: Fill in missing multiples on the hundred board and explain the pattern.

lessons.title: Skip Counting Word Problems
lessons.notes: Apply skip-counting to solve multiplicative comparison and equal-group contexts.

lessons.title: Partial Products with Arrays
lessons.notes: Split arrays into partial products to compute multiplication within 100.

lessons.title: Unknown Factors and Quotients
lessons.notes: Use inverse reasoning to find missing factors or quotients from array and area models.

lessons.title: Subtraction Contexts within 1,000
lessons.notes: Use bar models and recorded equations to solve multi-step subtraction problems within 1,000.

lessons.title: Three-Digit Subtraction Exchanges
lessons.notes: Model regrouping across hundreds, tens, and ones while subtracting within 1,000.

lessons.title: Time and Money Multi-Step Problems
lessons.notes: Blend elapsed time and coin counting within multi-step bar-model scenarios.

lessons.title: Elapsed Time Timeline
lessons.notes: Use clock faces and timelines to compute elapsed time to the nearest minute.

lessons.title: Start and End Time Challenges
lessons.notes: Find missing start or end times for events spanning up to several hours.

lessons.title: Check Two-Step Answers
lessons.notes: Use inverse operations and estimation to verify two-step solutions.

lessons.title: Plan Two-Step Solutions
lessons.notes: Sequence operations for two-step contexts and record each equation clearly.

lessons.title: Picture Chart Records
lessons.notes: Transfer sorted sets into a digital pictograph with auto-tally supports, then interpret and explain the recorded data.

lessons.title: Sorting Trays Classification
lessons.notes: Use digital sorting trays and labels to group objects by shared attributes, checking totals with built-in control of error.

lessons.title: Balance Scale Weight Comparisons
lessons.notes: Place objects on a digital balance to determine heavier, lighter, or equal.

lessons.title: Capacity Comparisons with Pitchers
lessons.notes: Fill pitchers to matching lines and describe which holds more or less.

lessons.title: Compare Length with Red Rods
lessons.notes: Order red rods by length and verbalize the attribute being compared.

lessons.title: Compare Sets with Bead Bars
lessons.notes: Place bead bars on scales, count totals, then choose comparison symbols to match.

lessons.title: Match Sets with Cards and Counters
lessons.notes: Learners pair counters to determine whether sets are equal before labeling greater or fewer.

lessons.title: Constructive Triangles Designs
lessons.notes: Combine triangles to build larger shapes and discuss the composite figure.

lessons.title: Decompose Shapes with Pattern Blocks
lessons.notes: Cover outlines with pattern blocks and explain how the whole is partitioned.

lessons.title: Fast Facts within 5
lessons.notes: Flash ten frames and bead stair images to build fluent addition and subtraction facts within five.

lessons.title: Act Out Join and Separate Stories
lessons.notes: Miniature objects move in and out of scenes; children retell the story with totals.

lessons.title: Ten Frame Story Equations
lessons.notes: Learners model the story on ten frames and record matching addition or subtraction equations.

lessons.title: Backward Counting Chain
lessons.notes: Slide arrows backward along the bead chain to practise counting down from teen numbers.

lessons.title: Teen Bead Chain Walk
lessons.notes: Move a marker along bead chains, place counting arrows, and narrate numbers 11â€“20.

lessons.title: Hundred Board Skip Counting
lessons.notes: Fill rows on the digital hundred board and highlight counting-by-ten patterns; offered after bead-chain mastery as a bridge into Grade 1 skip-counting goals.

lessons.title: Counting-On with the Addition Strip Board
lessons.notes: Slide strips to begin at a known addend and count on to find the sum.

lessons.title: Number Line Counting-On
lessons.notes: Hop forward from the larger addend and record the matching addition equation; positioned as the first Grade 1 counting-on bridge once strip-board work is fluent.

lessons.title: Backward Number Line Jumps
lessons.notes: Move a marker backward along a number line and narrate the count sequence.

lessons.title: Bead Stair Counting to 10
lessons.notes: Use the colored bead stair to extend counting and recognize scattered arrangements.

lessons.title: Number Bonds to 10
lessons.notes: Build number bonds for each total to ten using bead stair bars and record matching equations.

lessons.title: Ten Frame Quick Looks
lessons.notes: Show ten-frame flashes and have learners state the total without counting.

lessons.title: Ten Frame Numbers to 10
lessons.notes: Drag counters into digital ten frames, then record matching numerals.

lessons.title: Cards and Counters to 5
lessons.notes: Learners place counters under numeral cards and identify the total without recounting.

lessons.title: Count 1â€“5 with Number Rods
lessons.notes: Digital number rods three-period lesson establishing the sequence 1â€“5.

lessons.title: Quick Look Dots to 5
lessons.notes: Flash dot cards and five-frames to build instant recognition of quantities to five.

lessons.title: Successor and Predecessor with Bead Stair
lessons.notes: Swap bead bars to identify unknown numbers that come before or after in a sequence.

lessons.title: Number Line One More and One Less
lessons.notes: Learners move a marker along a digital number line to show the next and previous number.

lessons.title: Growing Patterns with the Bead Stair
lessons.notes: Use bead bars to build increasing patterns and articulate the growth rule.

lessons.title: Color Tablet Repeating Patterns
lessons.notes: Extend and label repeating cores using digital color tablets.

lessons.title: Command Game Maps
lessons.notes: Follow and create commands to place objects on simple digital maps.

lessons.title: Positional Words with Object Mat
lessons.notes: Move shapes around landmarks and describe locations using Montessori positional language.

lessons.title: Match Numerals, Words, and Beads
lessons.notes: Pair bead layouts with numeral cards and moveable word labels.

lessons.title: Ten Frames and Word Forms
lessons.notes: Fill double ten frames and select matching number words from a digital tray.

lessons.title: Compare 2D and 3D Shapes
lessons.notes: Match solids to the flat shapes on their faces and discuss similarities and differences.

lessons.title: Explore Geometric Solids
lessons.notes: Reveal solids from a mystery bag and match them to face cards.

lessons.title: Name Plane Shapes with the Geometry Cabinet
lessons.notes: Trace insets, match outlines, and label common 2D shapes.

lessons.title: Metal Inset Shape Drawings
lessons.notes: Trace digital metal insets, then freehand the shape outline and label attributes for a shape journal.

lessons.title: Stick Box Shape Modeling
lessons.notes: Use digital stick box pieces to construct teacher-called shapes, focusing on side lengths and vertices.

lessons.title: Record Subtraction Equations
lessons.notes: Use digit tiles to build subtraction equations that match modeled situations; unlocks Grade 1 equation recording once concrete take-away is solid.

lessons.title: Subtraction with Golden Beads
lessons.notes: Remove unit beads to model basic take-away stories and state the difference.

lessons.title: Number Line Take-Away
lessons.notes: Hop backward on a number line to show take-away within 20.

lessons.title: Teens with Golden Beads
lessons.notes: Form each teen with a ten bar and loose units, then record ten-plus-ones equations.

lessons.title: Build Teen Numbers with the Teens Board
lessons.notes: Slide unit cards over the ten board to read each teen number as ten and some ones.
